text: Walt Williams (born 7 May 1985) is a Grenadian retired track and field athlete who specialized in the throwing events. On April 28, 2007 he threw the shot put a distance of 17.26 m, in the process setting a national record. He won medals at the CARIFTA Games in both discus and shot put from 2000 to 2004.CARIFTA Games Boys Youth. GBR Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-08-26.CARIFTA Games Men Junior. GBR Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-08-26. He represented Grenada at the 2006 NACAC Under-23 Championships in Athletics, finishing in fifth place. In 2016 he launched a sporting club in order to develop athletes with the aim of having them qualify for the 2020 summer olympics.http://www.thegrenadainformer.com/carriacou/item/3397-former-carifta- medalist-launches-club-for-tokyo-2020 ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2000 |CARIFTA Games U17 |St. George's, Grenada |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |Shot put |13.55 m |- |rowspan=2|2001 |rowspan=2|CARIFTA Games U17 |rowspan=2|Bridgetown, Barbados |bgcolor=silver|2nd |Shot put |14.11 m |- |bgcolor=gold|1st |Discus throw |47.60 m |- |rowspan=2|2004 |rowspan=2|CARIFTA Games U20 |rowspan=2|Hamilton, Bermuda |bgcolor=silver|2nd |Shot put |16.69 m |- |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |Discus throw |49.55 m |- |2006 |NACAC U23 Championships |Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic |5th |Shot put |15.49 m |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Male shot putters Category:Grenadian male athletes
